EsminiRMlib¶

pyesminirmlib module

pyesminirmlib.RM_Close() → int¶

C++: RM_Close() –> int

pyesminirmlib.RM_CreatePosition() → int¶

Create a position object

Handle to the position object, to use for operations

C++: RM_CreatePosition() –> int

pyesminirmlib.RM_DeletePosition(handle: int) → int¶

Delete one or all position object(s)

Handle to the position object. Set -1 to delete all.

0 if succesful, -1 if specified position(s) could not be deleted

C++: RM_DeletePosition(int) –> int

pyesminirmlib.RM_GetIdOfRoadFromIndex(index: int) → int¶

Get the Road ID of the road with specified index. E.g. if there are 4 roads, index 3 means the last one.

The index of the road

The ID of the road

C++: RM_GetIdOfRoadFromIndex(int) –> int

pyesminirmlib.RM_GetLaneIdByIndex(roadId: int, laneIndex: int, s: float) → int¶

Get the ID of the lane given by index

The road ID

The index of the lane

The distance along the road at what point to look up the lane ID

The lane ID

C++: RM_GetLaneIdByIndex(int, int, float) –> int

Number of created position objects

Get the total number fo roads in the road network of the currently loaded OpenDRIVE file.

Number of roads

C++: RM_GetNumberOfRoads() –> int

pyesminirmlib.RM_GetRoadLength(id: int) → float¶

Get the lenght of road with specified ID

The road ID

The length of the road if ID exists, else 0.0

C++: RM_GetRoadLength(int) –> float

pyesminirmlib.RM_GetRoadNumberOfLanes(roadId: int, s: float) → int¶

Get the number of drivable lanes of specified road

The road ID

The distance along the road at what point to check number of lanes (which can vary along the road)

The number of drivable lanes

C++: RM_GetRoadNumberOfLanes(int, float) –> int

pyesminirmlib.RM_GetSpeedLimit(handle: int) → float¶

Retrieve current speed limit (at current road, s-value and lane) based on ODR type elements or nr of lanes

Handle to the position object

0 if successful, -1 if not

C++: RM_GetSpeedLimit(int) –> float

pyesminirmlib.RM_Init(odrFilename: str) → int¶

C++: RM_Init(const char *) –> int

pyesminirmlib.RM_PositionMoveForward(handle: int, dist: float, strategy: int) → int¶

Move position forward along the road. Choose way randomly though any junctions.

Handle to the position object

Distance (meter) to move

How to move in a junction where multiple route options appear, see Junction::JunctionStrategyType

0 if successful, -1 if not

C++: RM_PositionMoveForward(int, float, int) –> int

pyesminirmlib.RM_SetLanePosition(handle: int, roadId: int, laneId: int, laneOffset: float, s: float, align: bool) → int¶

Set position from road coordinates, world coordinates being calculated

Handle to the position object

Road specifier

Lane specifier

Offset from lane center

Distance along the specified road

If true the heading will be reset to the lane driving direction (typically only at initialization)

0 if successful, -1 if not

C++: RM_SetLanePosition(int, int, int, float, float, bool) –> int

pyesminirmlib.RM_SetS(handle: int, s: float) → int¶

Set s (distance) part of a lane position, world coordinates being calculated

Handle to the position object

Distance along the specified road

0 if successful, -1 if not

C++: RM_SetS(int, float) –> int

pyesminirmlib.RM_SetWorldPosition(handle: int, x: float, y: float, z: float, h: float, p: float, r: float) → int¶

Set position from world coordinates, road coordinates being calculated

Handle to the position object

cartesian coordinate x value

cartesian coordinate y value

cartesian coordinate z value

rotation heading value

rotation pitch value

rotation roll value

0 if successful, -1 if not

C++: RM_SetWorldPosition(int, float, float, float, float, float, float) –> int

pyesminirmlib.RM_SetWorldXYHPosition(handle: int, x: float, y: float, h: float) → int¶

Set position from world X, Y and heading coordinates; Z, pitch and road coordinates being calculated

Handle to the position object

cartesian coordinate x value

cartesian coordinate y value

rotation heading value

0 if successful, -1 if not

C++: RM_SetWorldXYHPosition(int, float, float, float) –> int
